Key Match Events: South Africa emerged with a three-wicket win with five balls to spare.
Roston Chase starred with bat and ball for the West Indies, scoring 52 runs and taking 3 wickets for 12 runs.
Alzarri Joseph took two vital wickets for 25 runs.
West Indies posted a total of 138 for 8.
South Africa's target was revised to 123 from 17 overs due to rain.
Tabraiz Shamsi was named man of the match for his 3 wickets for 27 runs.
Andre Russell took 2 wickets for 19 runs.
South Africa's Marco Jansen and Kagiso Rabada combined to see South Africa through at the death.
Marco Jansen hit an unbeaten 21 off 14 balls to secure the win for South Africa.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa captain Aiden Markram won the toss and elected to field.
Opener Shai Hope, who made a superb unbeaten 82 against USA on Friday, was gone without scoring off the first ball he faced.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram expressed relief at reaching the semifinal and acknowledged that his team has not played their best cricket yet.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell reflected on the team's overall improvement over the last 12 months, moving from number nine to number three in the world rankings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 17 overs per side.
South Africa's win probability stood at 78.87% as they began their chase.
The West Indies crowd remained supportive despite the team's struggles.
